qiskit_aqua.translators.ising package¶

Submodules¶

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.clique module¶

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.clique.get_clique_qubitops(weight_matrix, K)[source]¶

Generate Hamiltonian for the clique

Parameters:weight_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – adjacency matrix.
Returns:operator for the Hamiltonian and a constant shift for the obj function.
Return type:operator.Operator, float
Goals:
can we find a complete graph of size K?

Hamiltonian: suppose Xv denotes whether v should appear in the clique (Xv=1 or 0) H = Ha + Hb Ha = (K-sum_{v}{Xv})^2 Hb = K(K−1)/2 􏰏- sum_{(u,v)in E}{XuXv}

Besides, Xv = (Zv+1)/2 By replacing Xv with Zv and simplifying it, we get what we want below.

Note: in practice, we use H = A*Ha + Bb,
where A is a large constant such as 1000.

A is like a huge penality over the violation of Ha, which forces Ha to be 0, i.e., you have exact K vertices selected. Under this assumption, Hb = 0 starts to make sense, it means the subgraph constitutes a clique or complete graph. Note the lowest possible value of Hb is 0.

Without the above assumption, Hb may be negative (say you select all). In this case, one needs to use Hb^2 in the hamiltonian to minimize the difference.

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.exactcover module¶

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.exactcover.check_solution_satisfiability(sol, list_of_subsets)[source]¶
qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.exactcover.get_exactcover_qubitops(list_of_subsets)[source]¶

Construct the Hamiltonian for the exact solver problem

Parameters:list_of_subsets – list of lists (i.e., subsets)
Returns:operator for the Hamiltonian and a constant shift for the obj function.
Return type:operator.Operator, float
Assumption:
the union of the subsets contains all the elements to cover
The Hamiltonian is:
sum_{each element e}{(1-sum_{every subset_i that contains e}{Xi})^2}, where Xi (Xi=1 or 0) means whether should include the subset i.

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.graphpartition.get_graphpartition_qubitops(weight_matrix)[source]¶

Generate Hamiltonian for the graph partitioning

Parameters:weight_matrix (numpy.ndarray) – adjacency matrix.
Returns:operator for the Hamiltonian and a constant shift for the obj function.
Return type:operator.Operator, float
Goals:
1 separate the vertices into two set of the same size 2 make sure the number of edges between the two set is minimized.

Hamiltonian: H = H_A + H_B H_A = sum_{(i,j)in E}{(1-ZiZj)/2} H_B = (sum_{i}{Zi})^2 = sum_{i}{Zi^2}+sum_{i!=j}{ZiZj} H_A is for achieving goal 2 and H_B is for achieving goal 1.

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.setpacking module¶

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.setpacking.check_disjoint(sol, list_of_subsets)[source]¶
qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.setpacking.get_setpacking_qubitops(list_of_subsets)[source]¶

Construct the Hamiltonian for the set packing :param list_of_subsets: list of lists (i.e., subsets)

Returns:operator for the Hamiltonian and a constant shift for the obj function.
Return type:operator.Operator, float

find the maximal number of subsets which are disjoint pairwise.

Hamiltonian: H = A Ha + B Hb Ha = sum_{Si and Sj overlaps}{XiXj} Hb = -sum_{i}{Xi}

Ha is to ensure the disjoint condition, while Hb is to achieve the maximal number. Ha is hard constraint that must be satisified. Therefore A >> B. In the following, we set A=10 and B = 1

Note Xi = (Zi + 1)/2

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.setpacking.get_solution(x)[source]¶

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.tsp module¶

Convert symmetric TSP instances into Pauli list Deal with TSPLIB format. It supports only EUC_2D edge weight type. See https://wwwproxy.iwr.uni-heidelberg.de/groups/comopt/software/TSPLIB95/ and http://elib.zib.de/pub/mp-testdata/tsp/tsplib/tsp/index.html Design the tsp object w as a two-dimensional np.array e.g., w[i, j] = x means that the length of a edge between i and j is x Note that the weights are symmetric, i.e., w[j, i] = x always holds.

class qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.tsp.TspData(name, dim, coord, w)¶

Bases: tuple

coord¶

Alias for field number 2

count(value) → integer -- return number of occurrences of value¶
dim¶

Alias for field number 1

index(value[, start[, stop]]) → integer -- return first index of value.¶

Raises ValueError if the value is not present.

name¶

Alias for field number 0

w¶

Alias for field number 3

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.vertexcover.get_vertexcover_qubitops(weight_matrix)[source]¶

Generate Hamiltonian for the vertex cover :param weight_matrix: adjacency matrix. :type weight_matrix: numpy.ndarray

Returns:operator for the Hamiltonian and a constant shift for the obj function.
Return type:operator.Operator, float

Goals: 1 color some vertices as red such that every edge is connected to some red vertex 2 minimize the vertices to be colored as red

Hamiltonian: H = A * H_A + H_B H_A = sum_{(i,j)in E}{(1-Xi)(1-Xj)} H_B = sum_{i}{Zi}

H_A is to achieve goal 1 while H_b is to achieve goal 2. H_A is hard constraint so we place a huge penality on it. A=5. Note Xi = (Zi+1)/2

qiskit_aqua.translators.ising.vertexcover.parse_gset_format(filename)[source]¶
